results.title: Small body of still water
results.creator_credit: Dietmar Fill, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A pond is a small body of still water. Within this environment the life support elements of sun, water and oxygen enable the process of photosynthesis to take place, upon which much of the life in and around the pond is dependent.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dietmar Fill, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.description: A pond is a small body of still water. Within this environment the life support elements of sun, water and oxygen enable the process of photosynthesis to take place, upon which much of the life in and around the pond is dependent.

results.title: Slim pickings
results.brief_description: Using plasticene animation and miniature sets, motion control camera work and in camera effects, “Slim pickings” is a short animation mixing Hitchcock suspense with classic tragedy. On a hungry planet, a close friendship is tested. Cinematography by David Stevens.
results.description: Using plasticene animation and miniature sets, motion control camera work and in camera effects, “Slim pickings” is a short animation mixing Hitchcock suspense with classic tragedy. On a hungry planet, a close friendship is tested. Cinematography by David Stevens.

results.title: Sleeping Beauty
results.brief_description: This production of the classic ballet, “Sleeping Beauty” is performed by the Australian Ballet. Performed live at The Victorian Arts Centre, October 9, 1984, this ballet in a prologue and three acts has the beautiful Christine Walsh dancing the role of Aurora with touches of tenderness and grace, and David Ashmole creating an outstanding Prince Florimund. Music is performed by The Elizabethan Melbourne Orchestra, conducted by Ritchie Hanna.

results.title: Sky sailing: waiting for the wind
results.creator_credit: Alex Ciecierski, Marie Schurrer and Huemark Films
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the preparation and inspection of the hang glider prior to use, and shows learners receiving preliminary training before their first jump. The hang glider is shown in action, with a commentary describing techniques of sky sailing. Narrated by Stacey Foster.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alex Ciecierski, Marie Schurrer and Huemark Films

results.title: Sky pirates
results.creator_credit: C M Pennington-Richards, Frank Godwin and Ansus Films
results.brief_description: When their model plane crashes at the Aero Club, Mike and Harry are befriended by ex-pilot, Charlie Bradford, and his niece, Maggie, who teach them to fly radio controlled planes. Charlie invites them to the test flight of his new long distance aircraft which is later stolen. When they learn that a diamond has been stolen from the French State Museum, they realise the plane is to be used to smuggle the diamond out of the country.
results.creator_credit_for_label: C M Pennington-Richards, Frank Godwin and Ansus Films
results.description: When their model plane crashes at the Aero Club, Mike and Harry are befriended by ex-pilot, Charlie Bradford, and his niece, Maggie, who teach them to fly radio controlled planes. results.title: Life story
results.creator_credit: Joel Atkinson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Joel Atkinson’s parents split up, his dad took him to Shepparton. Determined to make the most of it, Atkinson worked hard to be a good role model for his siblings.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Joel Atkinson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Skittles
results.creator_credit: Daniel McCrimmon, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Daniel McCrimmon moved to Shepparton eight and a half years ago. He tells us of his time there, his friends, favorite places and his ambitions for the future.
